column4: is there an open source alternative to ms exchange? that supports shared calendars etc?
not really
cp -R $directory /$newlocation

cp -R .
cp -R . /$newlocation
man cp for the flags
do they have their own channel ?
you can't share a desktop you don't have
doesn't work like that, you share a desktop (or at last manage the sharing via a desktop)
the individual X windows are managed by the window manager,
don't use server
I dont want a gui... I cant boot the mini.iso either.. so now what?
it's probably too old now to contain the full instruction set that the kernel wants
remove the gui, just see if the CD will boot
error says please use a kernel appropiate for your cpu... so I should get an old verstion of ubuntu ?
depends what it wants
it used to be a common issue with VM's booting the ubuntu CD's as they didn't emmulate a CPU with certain instructions/components
that dependency has been in place for a good few years now, so you may be out of luck
I would have thought linux would be better suited to run on an older CPU than any other os :(
linux is a lot of distributions aren't
